intro: Schwenkfelda villosa, commonly known as the hairy schwenkfeldia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Schwenkfelda villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
